Detailed Description

This control displays editable text in a Cappuccino application.

Definition at line 87 of file CPTextField.j.

01065 
01066     if (_CGInsetIsEmpty(bezelInset))
01067         return bounds;
01068     
01069     bounds.origin.x += bezelInset.left;

00660     {
00661         if (_isEditing && ![self wraps])

00703         [[[self window] platformWindow] _propagateCurrentDOMEvent:YES];

- (CPRange) selectedRange   [implementation]

Definition at line 903 of file CPTextField.j.

00904 {
00905     if ([[self window] firstResponder] !== self)
00906         return CPMakeRange(0, 0);
00907 
00908     // we wrap this in try catch because firefox will throw an exception in certain instances
00909     try 
00910     {
00911         var inputElement = [self _inputElement],
00912             selectionStart = inputElement.selectionStart,
00913             selectionEnd = inputElement.selectionEnd;
00914 
00915         if ([selectionStart isKindOfClass:CPNumber])
00916             return CPMakeRange(selectionStart, selectionEnd - selectionStart);    
00917 
00918         // browsers which don't support selectionStart/selectionEnd (aka IE).
00919         var theDocument = inputElement.ownerDocument || inputElement.document,
00920             selectionRange = theDocument.selection.createRange(),
00921             range = inputElement.createTextRange();
00922 
00923         if (range.inRange(selectionRange))
00924         {
00925             range.setEndPoint('EndToStart', selectionRange);
00926             return CPMakeRange(range.text.length, selectionRange.text.length);
00927         }
00928     } 
00929     catch (e) 
00930     {
00931         // fall through to the return
00932     }
00933 
00934     return CGMakeRange(0, 0);
00935 }

- (void) setSelectedRange: (CPRange)  aRange   [implementation]

Definition at line 937 of file CPTextField.j.

00937                         :(CPRange)aRange
00938 {
00939     if (![[self window] firstResponder] === self)
00940         return;
00941 
00942     var inputElement = [self _inputElement];
00943 
00944     try 
00945     {
00946         if ([inputElement.selectionStart isKindOfClass:CPNumber])
00947         {
00948             inputElement.selectionStart = aRange.location;
00949             inputElement.selectionEnd = CPMaxRange(aRange);
00950         }
00951         else
00952         {
00953             // browsers which don't support selectionStart/selectionEnd (aka IE).
00954             var theDocument = inputElement.ownerDocument || inputElement.document,
00955                 existingRange = theDocument.selection.createRange(),
00956                 range = inputElement.createTextRange();
00957     
00958             if (range.inRange(existingRange))
00959             {
00960                 range.collapse(true);
00961                 range.move('character', aRange.location);
00962                 range.moveEnd('character', aRange.length);
00963                 range.select();
00964             }
00965         }
00966     }
00967     catch (e)
00968     {
00969     }
00970 }

- (void) sizeToFit   [implementation]

Size to fit has two behavior, depending on if the receiver is an editable text field or not.

For non-editable text fields (typically, a label), sizeToFit will change the frame of the receiver to perfectly fit the current text in stringValue in the current font, and respecting the current theme values for content-inset, min-size, and max-size.

For editable text fields, sizeToFit will ONLY change the HEIGHT of the text field. It will not change the width of the text field. You can use setFrameSize: with the current height to set the width, and you can get the size of a string with [CPString sizeWithFont:].

The logic behind this decision is that most of the time you do not know what content will be placed in an editable text field, so you want to just choose a fixed width and leave it at that size. However, since you don't know how tall it needs to be if you change the font, sizeToFit will still be useful for making the textfield an appropriate height.

Definition at line 812 of file CPTextField.j.

00813 {
00814     var size = [([self stringValue] || " ") sizeWithFont:[self currentValueForThemeAttribute:@"font"]],
00815         contentInset = [self currentValueForThemeAttribute:@"content-inset"],
00816         minSize = [self currentValueForThemeAttribute:@"min-size"],
00817         maxSize = [self currentValueForThemeAttribute:@"max-size"];
00818 
00819     size.width = MAX(size.width + contentInset.left + contentInset.right, minSize.width);
00820     size.height = MAX(size.height + contentInset.top + contentInset.bottom, minSize.height);
00821 
00822     if (maxSize.width >= 0.0)
00823         size.width = MIN(size.width, maxSize.width);
00824 
00825     if (maxSize.height >= 0.0)
00826         size.height = MIN(size.height, maxSize.height);
00827 
00828     if ([self isEditable])
00829         size.width = CGRectGetWidth([self frame]);
00830 
00831     [self setFrameSize:size];
00832 }
